subject: Can't run Junit on Windows - How can I help ?
msgSnippet: I am a newbie. I also ran into the fact that JUNIT doesn t use the pathSeparator of Java. The details can be found at
messageBody:
I am a newbie. I also ran into the fact that JUNIT doesn't use the
pathSeparator of Java. The details can be found at
http://rlucente.bloki.com/forum/messages-index.jsp?
tid=124461&fid=54832#forum-message1133407541851rlucente.

Since I am new, the best that I can do is offer to test and write
documentation.

rlucente@...


--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Hien Nguyen <aaavn123@y...> wrote:
>
>
> Thank you for your answer.
> I already fixed my problem, I didn't add JUnit Home
> directory my CLASSPATH, so when I did, it OK.
>
> I wrote JUNIT can't run on Windows because I saw:
>
> "java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: SimpleTest (wrong
> name: testjunit/SimpleTest)"
> on the error
>
> so I afraided that the separate of directory in the
> code of JUNIT don't use the pathSeparator of Java, it
> used the separate sign "/" of UNIX, so it can't run on
> Windows (windows used the "\" separator)
>
> Regard.
>
> --- Soaring Eagle <comfortable.numb@g...> wrote:
>
> > your test class is in the testjunit package. You are
> > running the
> > testrunner without the package name!
> >
> > try this:
> > --> java junit.textui.TestRunner
> > testjunit.SimpleTest
> >
> > and the make sure that the directory which contains
> > the testjunit
> > directory which contains SimpleTest.class is in your
> > class path.
> >
> > Last i remember, there is nothing platform specific
> > when you run java.
> > Please see WORA:
> > http://java.sun.com/features/1997/aug/wora.html
> >
